TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LinqDataSourceDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.DataSourceDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch to a designer view (such as **Design** view in Visual Studio), the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control markup is parsed. A design-time version of the control is then created on the design surface. When you switch to source view, the design-time control is persisted as the markup for the Web page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control in a visual designer.

block.para:
To provide commands in a derived class for the action list menu at design time, you must override the property. For this property, return a custom object that contains items that derive from the object.
For more information, see the class.

Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.related: Walkthrough: Creating a Basic Control Designer for a Web Server Control
How to: Extend the Appearance and Behavior of Controls in Design Mode

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property ActionLists As DesignerActionListCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a list of items that are used to create an action list menu at design time.
Docs.value: A collection that contains the action list items.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property CanConfigure As Boolean
public: virtual property bool CanConfigure { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the method can be called by the design host.
Docs.value: if the method can be called; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure%2A> method can be called if the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Site%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface. In that case, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanConfigure%2A> property value is `true`.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanConfigure%2A> property is `true`, the **Configure Data Source** menu item is displayed in the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu of the associated control on the visual designer surface. When this item is selected, the **Configure Data Source** wizard is started.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property CanRefreshSchema As Boolean
public: virtual property bool CanRefreshSchema { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the method can be called by the design host.
Docs.value: if the method can be called; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema%2A> method can be called if all the following conditions are true:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Site%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ITypeDiscoveryService?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSourceView.ContextTypeName%2A> property contains a value.
If these conditions are true, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> property value is `true`.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> is `true`, the **Refresh Schema** menu item is displayed in the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu of the associated control on the visual designer surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Configure() cil managed

Docs.summary: Launches the data source configuration wizard in the design host.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure%2A> method starts the **Configure Data Source** wizard on the visual designer surface.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.Configure%2A> method is called when the **Configure Data Source** menu item is selected on the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> control. The **Configure Data Source** menu item appears on the **LinqDataSource Tasks** menu when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanConfigure%2A> property is `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinqDataSource> instance, setting this property has no effect. This property shadows a property in the associated control, and is intended for internal use only.

Docs.param: to suppress all data source events until the schema is refreshed.
Docs.summary: Refreshes the schema from the underlying data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The design host calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema%2A> method only if <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDataSourceDesigner.CanRefreshSchema%2A> is `true`.
